newsitem.title: USA: Oxford Health sees 50 pct 1997 EPS gain.
newsitem.headline: Oxford Health sees 50 pct 1997 EPS gain.

text.p: Oxford Health Plans Inc Chief Executive Stephen Wiggins said on Wednesday the health maintenance organization expects its earnings to grow about 50 percent in 1997.
"We're expecting EPS growth for next year in the...50 percent range," Wiggins said following a presentation at a Piper Jaffray healthcare services conference.
He said he was comfortable with analysts' estimates for 1996 earnings at $1.22 a share and 1997 earnings at $1.75.
Oxford earned $0.71 a share in 1995, adjusted for a stock split.
First Call's consensus estimate for Oxford's 1996 earnings is $1.20 a share.
